definition: to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: They have a great contempt for conventionality.
They were bound up in fetters of conventionalism.
sentences.chinese: 他們被因襲主義的枷鎖所束縛。

sentences.english: But this is only a conventional literary conceit.
sentences.chinese: 但是這只是一種因襲的文人自負而已。

sentences.english: This new dress is the stylized design of the 18th century.
sentences.chinese: 這套新款服裝因襲了18世紀的款式。

sentences.english: So perhaps this is just keeping with tradition.
sentences.chinese: 這或許是因襲他們過去的傳統吧。

sentences.english: In the writing of old prose he approved of the naturalness and fluency and disapproved of the imitation.
sentences.chinese: 在古文寫作上強調文從字順，反對因襲模仿。
